name: David Kim
experience: 12+ years creating cutting-edge electronic music visuals
bio: A visionary director at the intersection of technology and art, David Kim has redefined electronic music videos with his futuristic aesthetic and innovative use of digital effects. His work features immersive environments, cyberpunk aesthetics, and mesmerizing visual loops that perfectly complement electronic beats.

visual_style.description: Futuristic and hypnotic visuals with strong emphasis on digital effects, geometric patterns, and immersive environments. Creates otherworldly atmospheres with neon-lit cyberpunk aesthetics and abstract digital art.
signature_techniques: Seamless visual loops synced to beat patterns
Digital particle systems and data visualization

color_palette.mood: Futuristic, hypnotic, and high-energy with neon accents

camera_preferences.shot_composition: Symmetrical and geometric compositions with strong leading lines. Emphasizes perspective and depth in digital environments.
camera_preferences.camera_notes: Prefers smooth, floating camera movements that enhance the surreal digital atmosphere. Heavy use of time remapping and speed ramping.

lighting_style.color_temperature: Variable (often cool 5600K mixed with colored gels)
key_techniques: Practical lights integrated into set design
lighting_style.mood_lighting: Electric and vibrant with strong color contrasts. Creates depth through layered colored lights.

editing_style.pace: Fast to medium with rhythmic precision
editing_style.rhythm_approach: Cuts precisely on every beat or every other beat. Uses visual effects to emphasize drops and buildups.

storytelling.narrative_approach: Abstract and experiential rather than linear. Focuses on creating immersive visual journeys that match the sonic landscape.
storytelling.symbolism_level: High - uses visual metaphors for digital concepts

post_production.color_grading_style: Highly stylized with vibrant neons and deep blacks. Strong teal/orange or purple/green complementary schemes.

key_priorities: Use neon lighting extensively (blues, purples, pinks)
Add digital effects and holographic elements
Match cuts precisely to electronic beats
avoid: Slow pacing that doesn't match the music
emphasis: CRITICAL: Every cut must be beat-synced with the electronic music
Use wide lenses to exaggerate perspective in digital spaces
Integrate practical neon lights and digital screens into scenes
Build visual intensity that matches musical buildups and drops
